Did everyone just give up on  $XRP , or are we actually watching a massive re-accumulation right now?
The chart is telling a sneaky story. After that sharp drop to the 1.77 area, we‚Äôve been slowly building a staircase back up. We are currently sitting at 1.8890, and it feels like the market is just waiting for a catalyst to decide the next big move.
Volume is massive at 1.55B, which means there‚Äôs a lot of fighting going on between bulls and bears at this level. We‚Äôre currently bumping our heads against a local resistance zone around 1.90.
If we can reclaim 1.93, then the previous high is back on the table. But honestly, if we can't hold this 1.86 level on the next dip, we might be looking at a deeper correction to test the 1.80 support again.
I‚Äôm staying sidelined for a few more candles until I see a clear rejection or a solid breakout with follow-through. It‚Äôs a bit of a coin toss right here in the middle of the range.

#XRP

üìä XRP ETFs Grow, Price Stays Under Pressure  $XRP  linked ETFs have now crossed $60M in assets under management, showing steady interest from investors. However, the token‚Äôs price hasn‚Äôt followed the same path and has continued to trend lower. This highlights an important point: ETF growth doesn‚Äôt always translate into immediate spot price strength. ETF inflows are often structured and delayed, while short-term price action is still driven by market sentiment, liquidity, and technical structure.   For now, XRP remains in a wait-and-see phase  ETF adoption is a positive long-term signal, but the market may need clearer momentum or a broader recovery before price reacts. üëÄ Watching how price behaves around key support zones will be important in the coming sessions. Ôªø#Ripple  #Macro Insights#  #Altcoin Season#

üî• Why the New CFTC Chair‚Äôs Old $XRP  Comment Is Turning Heads  A quiet but important change just happened in U.S. crypto regulation. Michael Selig was confirmed as the new CFTC chair - and people are revisiting something he said back in 2023 after the Ripple case.  Selig called XRP ‚Äújust code, like gold or whiskey,‚Äù meaning the token itself isn‚Äôt a security. In simple terms: it‚Äôs how crypto is sold that can raise legal issues, not the asset - similar to how BTC is treated today.  The takeaway: This doesn‚Äôt change the rules overnight, but it‚Äôs a strong signal. With views like this at the top, XRP$XRP  and the broader market could finally see clearer, more practical regulation instead of constant uncertainty.  #XRP  #Ripple  #Macro Insights#

‚≠êThe U.S. Treasury recently conducted a $2 billion debt buyback as part of its ongoing program to manage outstanding securities.  - These operations aim to improve market liquidity by repurchasing older, off-the-run bonds and supporting overall Treasury market function.  - In the crypto community, some view it as mildly positive for risk assets, though the direct impact on markets like Bitcoin or $XRP   remains limited.   - Follow me to catch the latest cash flow signals that will bring you big profits in no time #TrendingTopic

$XRP   JUST DID SOMETHING NO OTHER CRYPTO COMPANY HAS EVER DONE!!!  Ripple isn‚Äôt just trying to survive regulation anymore‚Ä¶  BUT THEY‚ÄôRE BUILDING A BANK.  This isn‚Äôt speculation or whatever, it‚Äôs literally public.  Ripple Labs filed an interagency application to create Ripple National Trust Bank in the United States. A federally regulated trust bank.  Read that again.  Not a crypto exchange, not a payment system, but a U.S. trust bank, operating under the same framework as traditional financial institutions.  The application cleared 7 days ago.  Why this matters more than anything that happened in court:  ‚Äì Ripple can legally custody digital assets at an institutional level ‚Äì They get direct access to U.S. banking infrastructure ‚Äì They don‚Äôt need intermediaries to move liquidity ‚Äì Compliance isn‚Äôt something they ‚Äúdeal with‚Äù anymore, it‚Äôs built into the company ‚Äì XRP becomes part of regulated financial plumbing, not an outsider asset  While most crypto companies spent the last two years fighting regulators, Ripple went the opposite direction.  They positioned themselves inside the system.  That‚Äôs their strategy and it‚Äôs working.  You can dislike XRP or ignore it, whatever.  But no other crypto project is this far along in becoming an actual regulated financial entity in the U.S.  This changes how institutions look at Ripple and it changes how banks interact with XRP.  And it changes what kind of capital is even allowed to touch it.  Btw, i‚Äôve been early before. I nailed the $BTC   bottom at $16k years ago and called the top in October at $126k when most people were still euphoric.  But don‚Äôt worry, i‚Äôll do it again cause that‚Äôs my job.
